In response to the delegation traveling to Taiwan, the People's Liberation Army's Eastern Theater Command in China conducted military exercises near Taiwan. 
 
"China firmly opposes any form of official interaction between the US and the Taiwan region.  The US side should abide by the one-China principle and the stipulations of the three China-US joint communiqués, stop official exchanges with Taiwan and avoid making irresponsible remarks," Zhao said. "The Chinese side will continue to take strong measures to resolutely safeguard its sovereignty and territorial integrity." 
 
Zhao made similar comments on Thursday, saying that the U.S. should " avoid going further down the dangerous path," and cease official interactions with Taiwan.

@bebopbalula @Delboyholmes Polestar's marketing makes a lot of sense on paper: focusing on design and building on top of Scandinavian roots that they want people to focus on (rather than ties to Geely/china). That Scandinavian simplicity, minimalism, eco-friendliness, and attention to the material their PR focuses on resembles $AAPL in many ways and should speak to the same audience/target groups (premium product turned into affordable luxury). Somehow doesn't feel authentic though, I see dozens of Polestars 2 on the roads here in NL every day with almost no advertising (so a bit similar to the $TSLA word of mouth marketing approach), but I don't think Polestar 2 is their iPhone type of a product yet, their cars need to catch up with the ambitions of what's shown in PR materials. Possibly Polestar 3 will be the one to fully convince me, still believe in the company long term.
